item.title: Barbara add a quote by Tao Te Ching
Barbara add a quote by Paul Wellstone
item.description: "Never separate the life you lead from the words you speak." -- Paul Wellstone

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Paul Wellstone
item.description: "Politics is not about big money or power games; it's about the improvement of people's lives" -- Paul Wellstone

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Paul Wellstone
item.description: "...how can we live in the richest, most privileged country in the world, at the peak of its economic performance, and still hear the Republicans, and too many Democrats, that we cannot afford to provide a good education for every child, that we cannot afford to provide health security for all our citizens?" -- Paul Wellstone

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Pericles
item.description: "Just because you do not take an interest in politics doesn't mean politics won't take an interest in you. " -- Pericles

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed. This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children. This is not a way of life at all in any true sense. Under the clouds of war, it is humanity hanging on a cross of iron." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Justice will not be served until those who are unaffected are as outraged as those who are." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Pamela Aidan
item.description: "Your move should be determined by your strengths, not your opponent's expectations.' Darcy's smile deepened as he warmed to her allusion to fencing. 'Always move to your advantage." -- Pamela Aidan

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Kate Morton
item.description: "Memory is a cruel mistress with whom we all must learn to dance." -- Kate Morton

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Cynthia Ozick
item.description: "We often take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude." -- Cynthia Ozick

item.title: Barbara add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world." -- John Muir
